meanings.definition: A person who digs or drills for oil or minerals.
meanings.sent1: The spudders worked hard to find oil deep underground.
meanings.sent2: The team of spudders discovered a rich oil reserve.
meanings.sent3: The spudders joked about striking it rich with their drilling skills.
meanings.sent4: The spudders were like modern-day treasure hunters in search of black gold.
meanings.sent5: The image of the spudders covered in dirt and oil was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A machine used for drilling holes in the ground.
meanings.sent1: The spudders were essential in creating wells for water.
meanings.sent2: The old spudders were replaced with more advanced drilling equipment.
meanings.sent3: The spudders hummed as they bored into the earth.
meanings.sent4: The spudders roared to life, piercing the ground with precision.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the spudders echoed through the valley, signaling progress.

meanings.definition: To dig or drill with a spudder.
meanings.sent1: He spudders into the ground to plant the seeds.
meanings.sent2: They spudders carefully to avoid hitting any pipes underground.
meanings.sent3: She spudders away, hoping to unearth buried treasure.
meanings.sent4: The workers spudders tirelessly to reach the water source.
meanings.sent5: The farmer spudders the soil, preparing it for the new season.
